definition: meager/slight/weak/ungenerous or unkind/frivolous/to despise/to belittle/to look down on/to approach or near

sentences.english: Has forded your frivolous lens, I see the profound pupil.
sentences.chinese: 涉过你轻薄的镜片，我看到深邃的瞳孔。

sentences.english: A serious political speech should not be full of frivolities .
sentences.chinese: 一篇严肃的政治演讲不该充斥着轻薄无聊的话。

sentences.english: Thin fibre-optic cable has replaced huge tonnages of copper wire.
sentences.chinese: 轻薄的光纤电缆已取代了无数吨重的铜线。

sentences.english: The lightening and thinning of wool product is an irreversible tendency in wool spinning industry of today.
sentences.chinese: 羊毛产品轻薄化是当今毛纺行业不可逆转的趋势。
有微微的风和轻薄的雾。

sentences.english: “Look how flimsy their menus are,” Bessie giggle.
sentences.chinese: 看，他们的菜单多么轻薄易破啊。

sentences.english: When dry, mist your fringe with a lightweight hair spray.
sentences.chinese: 刘海干了后，用一款轻薄的喷发定型剂喷在上面定型。

sentences.english: The frivolous gauze account on bedstead.
A lightweight, oil free sun care lotion for your body.
sentences.chinese: 为您的身体打造的一款轻薄无油的防晒护肤乳液。

sentences.english: An ultra-thin & light digital pen with a regular and replaceable ink cartridge.
sentences.chinese: 超轻薄的定期更换墨盒和数码笔。

sentences.english: She was so sweet, so soft-looking in her thin white dress.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着那身轻薄的衣衫，显得很甜蜜，很柔软。

sentences.english: She wore a sheer sweater and a skirt that flattered her long legs.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着轻薄的毛衣，一条裙子让她的长腿分外动人。

sentences.english: And to get that leggy profile, go bare-legged or wear sheer hose。
sentences.chinese: 要想显得腿部修长，那就裸露双腿，或穿轻薄长袜。

sentences.english: Thee-Book readers have been designed in thin and light for easily hold in the palm of the hand.
sentences.chinese: 电子图书阅读器已在设计轻薄，可方便地把握在手心。

sentences.english: Youth are always too serious, and just now it is too serious about frivolity .
sentences.chinese: 青年时代总是过于认真的，而时下青年则过分轻薄。

sentences.english: The slim table board with the higher level design, combines modern and stable.
sentences.chinese: 轻薄桌面，挑空桌面设计，稳重中不失现代感。

definition: meager/slight/weak/ungenerous or unkind/frivolous/to despise/to belittle/to look down on/to approach or near
to flow freely (of air)/to ventilate/to breathe (of fabric etc)/to take a breath of fresh air/to divulge
